cards.flavor: "Take a moment. Ponder the depths of your insignificance."
cards.name: All in Good Time
cards.text: When you set this scheme in motion, take an extra turn after this one. Schemes can't be set in motion that turn.

cards.flavor: Only leonin clerics who can survive the Razor Fields for one turning of the suns can stand in the Cave of Light.
cards.name: Leonin Abunas
cards.text: Artifacts you control have hexproof. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

cards.flavor: "It's my goal to find the melting point of every substance."
cards.imageName: all shall smolder in my wake
cards.name: All Shall Smolder in My Wake
cards.text: When you set this scheme in motion, destroy up to one target artifact, up to one target enchantment, and up to one target nonbasic land.

cards.flavor: "By the time I got there, the heart had stopped. Fortunately, I was able to replace it with something better."
cards.name: Metallurgeon
cards.text: {W}, {T}: Regenerate target artifact.

cards.name: Oblivion Ring
cards.text:
When Oblivion Ring enters the battlefield, exile another target nonland permanent.
When Oblivion Ring leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control.

cards.flavor: "It's a dragon-infested lavascape of notorious peril. Make yourselves at home."
cards.name: Approach My Molten Realm
cards.text: When you set this scheme in motion, until your next turn, if a source would deal damage, it deals double that damage instead.

cards.name: Path to Exile
cards.text: Exile target creature. Its controller may search his or her library for a basic land card, put that card onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle his or her library.

cards.flavor: "I'd call that a successful first test. Golem! Rearm the Doom Citadel!"
cards.name: Behold the Power of Destruction
cards.text: When you set this scheme in motion, destroy all nonland permanents target opponent controls.

cards.flavor: As their supplies of etherium dwindled, mechanists sent gargoyles farther and farther afield in search of salvage.
cards.name: Sanctum Gargoyle
cards.text:
Flying
When Sanctum Gargoyle enters the battlefield, you may return target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor: "It seems the fate of the world rests on your shoulders, feeble child."
cards.name: Choose Your Champion
cards.text: When you set this scheme in motion, target opponent chooses a player. Until your next turn, only you and the chosen player can cast spells and attack with creatures.

cards.name: Dance, Pathetic Marionette
cards.text: When you set this scheme in motion, each opponent reveals cards from the top of his or her library until he or she reveals a creature card. Choose one of the revealed creature cards and put it onto the battlefield under your control. Put all other cards revealed this way into their owners' graveyards.

cards.name: March of the Machines
cards.text: Each noncreature artifact is an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost. (Equipment that's a creature can't equip a creature.)

cards.flavor: "Tell your old master I said hello."
cards.name: The Dead Shall Serve
cards.text: When you set this scheme in motion, for each opponent, put up to one target creature card from that player's graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. Each of those creatures attacks its owner each combat if able.

cards.flavor: "Wasted potential surrounds us. Lend me that bauble, and let me see what it can be made to be."
cards.name: Master Transmuter
cards.text: {U}, {T}, Return an artifact you control to its owner's hand: You may put an artifact card from your hand onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Spin into Myth
cards.text: Put target creature on top of its owner's library, then fateseal 2. (To fateseal 2, look at the top two cards of an opponent's library, then put any number of them on the bottom of that player's library and the rest on top in any order.)

cards.flavor: "What would you say is my greatest attribute? Is it my gluttonous lust for power?"
cards.imageName: a display of my dark power
cards.name: A Display of My Dark Power
cards.text: When you set this scheme in motion, until your next turn, whenever a player taps a land for mana, that player adds one mana to his or her mana pool of any type that land produced.

cards.flavor: "My vision is for the good of everyone. Mostly me."
cards.name: Embrace My Diabolical Vision
cards.text: When you set this scheme in motion, each player shuffles his or her hand and graveyard into his or her library. You draw seven cards, then each other player draws four cards.

cards.name: Avatar of Woe
cards.text:
If there are ten or more creature cards total in all graveyards, Avatar of Woe costs {6} less to cast.
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
{T}: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated.

cards.flavor: "Oh, I think I will get away with this."
cards.name: Every Hope Shall Vanish
cards.text: When you set this scheme in motion, each opponent reveals his or her hand. Choose a nonland card from each of those hands. Those players discard those cards.

cards.flavor: A vertical scream pierces the night air and echoes doom through the clouds.
cards.name: Beacon of Unrest
cards.text: Put target artifact or creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. Shuffle Beacon of Unrest into its owner's library.

cards.flavor: "May bloodberries grow from your remains."
cards.name: Every Last Vestige Shall Rot
cards.text: When you set this scheme in motion, you may pay {X}. If you do, put each nonland permanent target player controls with converted mana cost X or less on the bottom of its owner's library.

cards.flavor: The world is the body. The mana is the blood. The witch is the surgeon.
cards.name: Bog Witch
cards.text: {B}, {T}, Discard a card: Add {B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: "The plants justify the means."
cards.name: Evil Comes to Fruition
cards.text: When you set this scheme in motion, put seven 0/1 green Plant creature tokens onto the battlefield. If you control ten or more lands, put seven 3/3 green Elemental creature tokens onto the battlefield instead.

cards.flavor: Every grave cradles a recruit.
cards.name: Cemetery Reaper
cards.text:
Other Zombie creatures you control get +1/+1.
{2}{B}, {T}: Exile target creature card from a graveyard. Put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.name: The Fate of the Flammable
cards.text: When you set this scheme in motion, target opponent chooses self or others. If that player chooses self, this scheme deals 6 damage to him or her. If the player chooses others, this scheme deals 3 damage to each of your other opponents.

cards.name: Corpse Connoisseur
cards.text:
When Corpse Connoisseur enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a creature card and put that card into your graveyard. If you do, shuffle your library.
Unearth {3}{B} ({3}{B}: Return this card from your graveyard to the battlefield. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step or if it would leave the battlefield. Unearth only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor: "Even you have a purpose. Your blood will oil the gears."
cards.name: Feed the Machine
cards.text: When you set this scheme in motion, target opponent chooses self or others. If that player chooses self, he or she sacrifices two creatures. If the player chooses others, each of your other opponents sacrifices a creature.

cards.flavor: The undead of Grixis are fueled by their hatred of the living.
cards.name: Dregscape Zombie
cards.text: Unearth {B} ({B}: Return this card from your graveyard to the battlefield. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step or if it would leave the battlefield. Unearth only as a sorcery.)

cards.imageName: i bask in your silent awe
cards.name: I Bask in Your Silent Awe
cards.text:
(An ongoing scheme remains face up until it's abandoned.)
Each opponent can't cast more than one spell each turn.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if no opponent cast a spell since your last turn ended, abandon this scheme.

cards.name: Extractor Demon
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever another creature leaves the battlefield, you may have target player put the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
Unearth {2}{B} ({2}{B}: Return this card from your graveyard to the battlefield. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step or if it would leave the battlefield. Unearth only as a sorcery.)

cards.imageName: i call on the ancient magics
cards.name: I Call on the Ancient Magics
cards.text: When you set this scheme in motion, each other player searches his or her library for a card, reveals it, and puts it into his or her hand. Then you search your library for two cards and put them into your hand. Each player shuffles his or her library.

cards.flavor: In life, it was a fetid, disease-ridden thing. In death, not much changed.
cards.name: Festering Goblin
cards.text: When Festering Goblin dies, target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Shadowmoor's main crops are rot, slime, and despair.
cards.name: Incremental Blight
cards.text: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature, two -1/-1 counters on another target creature, and three -1/-1 counters on a third target creature.

cards.flavor: "I can't imagine what you're feeling right now, but I'll try my best."
cards.name: I Delight in Your Convulsions
cards.text: When you set this scheme in motion, each opponent loses 3 life. You gain life equal to the life lost this way.

cards.flavor: Not once in the history of Grixis has anyone died of old age.
cards.name: Infectious Horror
cards.text: Whenever Infectious Horror attacks, each opponent loses 2 life.

cards.imageName: i know all, i see all
cards.name: I Know All, I See All
cards.text:
(An ongoing scheme remains face up until it's abandoned.)
Untap all permanents you control during each opponent's untap step.
At the beginning of each end step, if three or more cards were put into your graveyard this turn from anywhere, abandon this scheme.

cards.flavor: "Heroes innovate. Villains duplicate."
cards.name: Ignite the Cloneforge!
cards.text: When you set this scheme in motion, put a token onto the battlefield that's a copy of target permanent an opponent controls.

cards.flavor:
"This is why we don't go out in banewasp weather."
—Rannon, Vithian holdout
cards.name: Infest
cards.text: All creatures get -2/-2 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"This vulgar mimicry will end now."
—Desmera, perfect of Wren's Run
cards.name: Makeshift Mannequin
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield with a mannequin counter on it. For as long as that creature has a mannequin counter on it, it has "When this creature becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice it."

cards.flavor: "You may even see them again. Full digestion takes three hundred years."
cards.name: Into the Earthen Maw
cards.text: When you set this scheme in motion, exile up to one target creature with flying, up to one target creature without flying, and all cards from up to one target opponent's graveyard.

cards.flavor:
"You will learn to earn death."
—Volrath
cards.name: Reanimate
cards.text: Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. You lose life equal to its converted mana cost.

cards.flavor: "Meet my newest minion. Come now, don't be shy—shake her pincer."
cards.name: Introductions Are in Order
cards.text:
When you set this scheme in motion, choose one —
• Search your library for a creature card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.
• You may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor: "It would be disappointing if you were unable to overcome this simplest of defenses. Hilarious, but disappointing."
cards.name: The Iron Guardian Stirs
cards.text: When you set this scheme in motion, put a 4/6 colorless Golem artifact creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor: Though you may see the same bones, you'll never see the same skeleton twice.
cards.name: Reassembling Skeleton
cards.text: {1}{B}: Return Reassembling Skeleton from your graveyard to the battlefield tapped.

cards.name: Scion of Darkness
cards.text:
Trample
Whenever Scion of Darkness deals combat damage to a player, you may put target creature card from that player's graveyard onto the battlefield under your control.
Cycling {3} ({3}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

cards.flavor: "Cranial explosions for everyone. Still planning to outthink my dragons?"
cards.name: Know Naught but Fire
cards.text: When you set this scheme in motion, it deals damage to each opponent equal to the number of cards in that player's hand.

cards.name: Shriekmaw
cards.text:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
When Shriekmaw enters the battlefield, destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature.
Evoke {1}{B} (You may cast this spell for its evoke cost. If you do, it's sacrificed when it enters the battlefield.)

cards.flavor: "Today I take the reins of destiny itself. Today the Draconic Apocalypse is upon you."
cards.name: Look Skyward and Despair
cards.text: When you set this scheme in motion, put a 5/5 red Dragon creature token with flying onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor: "This should halt the spread of your insolence."
cards.name: May Civilization Collapse
cards.text: When you set this scheme in motion, target opponent chooses self or others. If that player chooses self, he or she sacrifices two lands. If the player chooses others, each of your other opponents sacrifices a land.

cards.flavor:
"You know I accept only one currency here, and yet you have sought me out. Why now do you hesitate?"
—Xathrid demon
cards.name: Sign in Blood
cards.text: Target player draws two cards and loses 2 life.

cards.name: Twisted Abomination
cards.text:
{B}: Regenerate Twisted Abomination.
Swampcycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for a Swamp card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.)

cards.flavor: "I certainly would have accepted my offer of eternal life. But if you choose death instead, who am I to argue?"
cards.name: Mortal Flesh Is Weak
cards.text: When you set this scheme in motion, each opponent's life total becomes the lowest life total among your opponents.

cards.name: My Crushing Masterstroke
cards.text: When you set this scheme in motion, gain control of all nonland permanents your opponents control until end of turn. Untap those permanents. They gain haste until end of turn. Each of them attacks its owner this turn if able.

cards.flavor: "I have become a gourmet of sorts. Each soul has its own distinctive flavor. The art is in inviting the right company to the feast."
cards.name: Urborg Syphon-Mage
cards.text: {2}{B}, {T}, Discard a card: Each other player loses 2 life. You gain life equal to the life lost this way.

cards.flavor: The nomads' funeral pyres are more practical than ceremonial.
cards.name: Zombie Infestation
cards.text: Discard two cards: Put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor: "I can see . . . everything. The beginning and the end of time. The raw edges of reality. And now I see exactly how to kill you."
cards.name: My Genius Knows No Bounds
cards.text: When you set this scheme in motion, you may pay {X}. If you do, you gain X life and draw X cards.

cards.flavor:
"The first birth celebrates life. The second birth mocks it."
—Mystic elder
cards.name: Zombify
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.

cards.name: My Undead Horde Awakens
cards.text:
(An ongoing scheme remains face up until it's abandoned.)
At the beginning of your end step, you may put target creature card from an opponent's graveyard onto the battlefield under your control.
When a creature put onto the battlefield with this scheme dies, abandon this scheme.

cards.flavor: "Indulge me. Just one spell. One potentially fatal spell gone horribly awry."
cards.name: My Wish Is Your Command
cards.text: When you set this scheme in motion, each opponent reveals his or her hand. You may choose a noncreature, nonland card revealed this way and cast it without paying its mana cost.

cards.flavor: Their skeletons can be found all over Skirk Ridge, tangled in each other's horns.
cards.name: Battering Craghorn
cards.text:
First strike
Morph {1}{R}{R} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

cards.name: Breath of Darigaaz
cards.text:
Kicker {2} (You may pay an additional {2} as you cast this spell.)
Breath of Darigaaz deals 1 damage to each creature without flying and each player. If Breath of Darigaaz was kicked, it deals 4 damage to each creature without flying and each player instead.

cards.name: Nature Demands an Offering
cards.text: When you set this scheme in motion, target opponent chooses a creature you don't control and puts it on top of its owner's library, then repeats this process for an artifact, an enchantment, and a land. Then the owner of each permanent chosen this way shuffles his or her library.

cards.flavor:
"Her mind is an incredible mix of emotion and power. Even if I could grasp it, I couldn't hold it for long."
—Jace Beleren, on Chandra Nalaar
cards.name: Chandra's Outrage
cards.text: Chandra's Outrage deals 4 damage to target creature and 2 damage to that creature's controller.

cards.name: Nature Shields Its Own
cards.text:
(An ongoing scheme remains face up until it's abandoned.)
Whenever a creature attacks and isn't blocked, if you're the defending player, put a 0/1 green Plant creature token onto the battlefield blocking that creature.
When four or more creatures attack you, abandon this scheme at end of combat.

cards.name: Nothing Can Stop Me Now
cards.text:
(An ongoing scheme remains face up until it's abandoned.)
If a source an opponent controls would deal damage to you, prevent 1 of that damage.
At the beginning of each end step, if you've been dealt 5 or more damage this turn, abandon this scheme.

cards.name: Dragon Breath
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has haste.
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
When a creature with converted mana cost 6 or greater enters the battlefield, you may return Dragon Breath from your graveyard to the battlefield attached to that creature.

cards.flavor: "But nothing will end your regret."
cards.name: Only Blood Ends Your Nightmares
cards.text: When you set this scheme in motion, each opponent sacrifices a creature. Then each opponent who didn't sacrifice a creature discards two cards.

cards.flavor: Goblins journey to the sacrificial peaks in pairs so that the rare survivor might be able to relate the details of the other's grisly demise.
cards.name: Dragon Fodder
cards.text: Put two 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor: "Cretins build machines. I construct destiny."
cards.name: The Pieces Are Coming Together
cards.text: When you set this scheme in motion, draw two cards. Artifact spells you cast this turn cost {2} less to cast.

cards.name: Dragon Whelp
cards.text:
Flying
{R}: Dragon Whelp gets +1/+0 until end of turn. If this ability has been activated four or more times this turn, sacrifice Dragon Whelp at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.flavor: "Look around you. All you behold is mine to rule. It's the natural way."
cards.name: Realms Befitting My Majesty
cards.text: When you set this scheme in motion, search your library for up to two basic land cards, put them onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: "We speak the dragons' language of flame and rage. They speak our language of fury and honor. Together we shall weave a tale of destruction without equal."
cards.name: Dragonspeaker Shaman
cards.text: Dragon spells you cast cost {2} less to cast.

cards.flavor: "I assure you, these are not the kind that thrive on sunlight and water."
cards.name: Roots of All Evil
cards.text: When you set this scheme in motion, put five 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Fireball
cards.text:
Fireball deals X damage divided evenly, rounded down, among any number of target creatures and/or players.
Fireball costs {1} more to cast for each target beyond the first.

cards.flavor: Dragon lords of Jund rule by edicts of flame.
cards.name: Flameblast Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Flameblast Dragon attacks, you may pay {X}{R}. If you do, Flameblast Dragon deals X damage to target creature or player.

cards.flavor: "Don't come back until you've got brains in your teeth."
cards.name: Rotted Ones, Lay Siege
cards.text: When you set this scheme in motion, for each opponent, put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield that attacks that player each combat if able.

cards.flavor: Baby dragons can't figure out humans—if they didn't want to be killed, why were they made of meat and treasure?
cards.name: Furnace Whelp
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{R}: Furnace Whelp gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: "Or, if you prefer, just surrender."
cards.name: Surrender Your Thoughts
cards.text: When you set this scheme in motion, target opponent chooses self or others. If that player chooses self, he or she discards four cards. If the player chooses others, each of your other opponents discards two cards.

cards.flavor: "Silence your wailing. This is but a taste of the destruction my pets have in store."
cards.name: Tooth, Claw, and Tail
cards.text: When you set this scheme in motion, destroy up to three target nonland permanents.

cards.text:
Hellbent — Gathan Raiders gets +2/+2 as long as you have no cards in hand.

Flying, haste

cards.text:
(An ongoing scheme remains face up until it's abandoned.)
Creatures you control get +2/+2 and have trample.
When a creature you control dies, abandon this scheme.

cards.flavor: "Let that be a lesson to you, your family, and everyone you've ever known."
cards.name: Which of You Burns Brightest?
cards.text: When you set this scheme in motion, you may pay {X}. If you do, this scheme deals X damage to target opponent and each creature he or she controls.

Flying

When Imperial Hellkite is turned face up, you may search your library for a Dragon card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: "I can't abide laziness. Arise, forces of nature, and serve your master!"
cards.name: Your Fate Is Thrice Sealed
cards.text: When you set this scheme in motion, reveal the top three cards of your library. Put all land cards revealed this way onto the battlefield and the rest into your hand.

cards.flavor: "Do you smell something burning?"

cards.text:

Amplify 3 (As this creature enters the battlefield, put three +1/+1 counters on it for each Dragon card you reveal in your hand.)

{T}: Kilnmouth Dragon deals damage equal to the number of +1/+1 counters on it to target creature or player.

cards.flavor: "I have seen far beyond this imperfect world, into a tomorrow that doesn't include you."
cards.name: Your Puny Minds Cannot Fathom
cards.text: When you set this scheme in motion, draw four cards. You have no maximum hand size until your next turn.

cards.flavor: "Fool. I'll show you how to use that thing."

cards.text: When you set this scheme in motion, gain control of target creature an opponent controls until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gets +3/+3 and gains trample and haste until end of turn.

cards.name: Ryusei, the Falling Star
cards.text:
Flying
When Ryusei, the Falling Star dies, it deals 5 damage to each creature without flying.

cards.flavor: Vulshok mana rituals echo the day when the red sun burst through Mirrodin's surface to take its place in the heavens.

cards.text: Add {R}{R}{R}{R}{R} to your mana pool.

Morph {2}{R} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

"How can we outrun the sky?"
—Hadran, sunseeder of Naya

cards.flavor:
"I fear no army or beast, but only the morning fog. Our assault can survive everything else."
—Lord Hilneth

cards.text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.

cards.flavor: Its blood is life. Its body is growth.

cards.flavor: "My mind has changed. My strength has not."

cards.flavor: Eidren, perfect of Lys Alana, ordered hundreds of trees uprooted and rearranged into a pattern he deemed beautiful. Thus the Gilt-Leaf Wood was born.
cards.name: Leaf Gilder
cards.text: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: "My mind is the spread of the canopy. My heart is the embrace of the roots. I am deathless Llanowar, its fury and its peace."
cards.name: Molimo, Maro-Sorcerer
cards.text:
Trample (If this creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)
Molimo, Maro-Sorcerer's power and toughness are each equal to the number of lands you control.

cards.flavor: "You are the grandest of all," said the archdruid to the trees. They became so proud of bark and branch that they suffered no creature to fly overhead or perch upon a bough.
cards.name: Plummet
cards.text: Destroy target creature with flying.

cards.name: Primal Command
cards.text:
Choose two —
• Target player gains 7 life.
• Put target noncreature permanent on top of its owner's library.
• Target player shuffles his or her graveyard into his or her library.
• Search your library for a creature card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: Hatred outlives the hateful.
cards.name: Rancor
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+0 and has trample.
When Rancor is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return Rancor to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor: Slain orochi warriors were buried with a tree sapling so they would become a part of the forest after death.
cards.name: Sakura-Tribe Elder
cards.text: Sacrifice Sakura-Tribe Elder: Search your library for a basic land card, put that card onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Shinen of Life's Roar
cards.text:
All creatures able to block Shinen of Life's Roar do so.
Channel — {2}{G}{G}, Discard Shinen of Life's Roar: All creatures able to block target creature this turn do so.

cards.name: Spider Umbra
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and has reach. (It can block creatures with flying.)
Totem armor (If enchanted creature would be destroyed, instead remove all damage from it and destroy this Aura.)

cards.name: Thelonite Hermit
cards.text:
Saproling creatures get +1/+1.
Morph {3}{G}{G} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
When Thelonite Hermit is turned face up, put four 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Verdeloth the Ancient
cards.text:
Kicker {X} (You may pay an additional {X} as you cast this spell.)
Saproling creatures and other Treefolk creatures get +1/+1.
When Verdeloth the Ancient enters the battlefield, if it was kicked, put X 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor: Sometimes the wise ones wove their magic into living plants; as the plant grew, so grew the magic.
cards.name: Wall of Roots
cards.text:
Defender
Put a -0/-1 counter on Wall of Roots: Add {G} to your mana pool. Activate this ability only once each turn.

cards.flavor: "Living scarecrows make a mockery of the natural order. Dead ones make fine hats."
cards.name: Wickerbough Elder
cards.text:
Wickerbough Elder enters the battlefield with a -1/-1 counter on it.
{G}, Remove a -1/-1 counter from Wickerbough Elder: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

cards.flavor: The parched earth still shielded those few souls with the heart to call it home.
cards.name: Yavimaya Dryad
cards.text:
Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
When Yavimaya Dryad enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a Forest card and put it onto the battlefield tapped under target player's control. If you do, shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: Life's circle has become inverted in Grixis. The same energy is endlessly recycled and becomes more stagnant with each pass.
cards.name: Agony Warp
cards.text:
Target creature gets -3/-0 until end of turn.
Target creature gets -0/-3 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: This secret society of mages manipulates the beliefs and opinions of others.
cards.name: Architects of Will
cards.text:
When Architects of Will enters the battlefield, look at the top three cards of target player's library, then put them back in any order.

cards.name: Armadillo Cloak
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has trample.
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage, you gain that much life.

cards.flavor: Such is the power of Rakdos that even his shadow takes on a cruel life of its own.
cards.name: Avatar of Discord
cards.text:
({B/R} can be paid with either {B} or {R}.)
Flying
When Avatar of Discord enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you discard two cards.

cards.name: Batwing Brume
cards.text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn if {W} was spent to cast Batwing Brume. Each player loses 1 life for each attacking creature he or she controls if {B} was spent to cast Batwing Brume. (Do both if {W}{B} was spent.)

cards.name: Bituminous Blast
cards.text:
Cascade (When you cast this spell, exile cards from the top of your library until you exile a nonland card that costs less. You may cast it without paying its mana cost. Put the exiled cards on the bottom in a random order.)
Bituminous Blast deals 4 damage to target creature.

cards.flavor:
"Lightning lives in everything, in living flesh and growing things. It must be set free."
—Rakka Mar
cards.name: Branching Bolt
cards.text:
Choose one or both —

• Branching Bolt deals 3 damage to target creature without flying.

cards.flavor:
"Never corner a barbarian. You become the path of least resistance."
—Sarkhan Vol

cards.flavor:
"You helped save my people from a Phyrexian fate. Did you think I wouldn't return the favor?"
—Eladamri, to Gerrard

cards.text: Target player gains 7 life.

cards.flavor:
"Rats and jackals feast in his swath, but even they will not walk with him."
—Mangara
cards.name: Kaervek the Merciless
cards.text: Whenever an opponent casts a spell, Kaervek the Merciless deals damage to target creature or player equal to that spell's converted mana cost.

cards.flavor: "These benighted worlds are thick with ignorance. I will educate them. They will listen, or they will die."

Flying

cards.flavor:
"Nature is the ultimate mindless destroyer, capable of power and ferocity no army can match, and the Gruul follow its example."
—Trigori, Azorius senator

cards.flavor:
"I've seen death before. My mother succumbing to illness, my comrades bleeding on the battlefield . . . But I'd never seen anything as dreadful as that."
—Taani, berserker of Etlan
cards.name: Terminate
cards.text: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Torrent of Souls
cards.text: Return up to one target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield if {B} was spent to cast Torrent of Souls. Creatures target player controls get +2/+0 and gain haste until end of turn if {R} was spent to cast Torrent of Souls. (Do both if {B}{R} was spent.)

cards.flavor: Creations made in madness may contain great power. The path to that power is as labyrinthine as the creator's mind.
cards.name: Unbender Tine
cards.text: {T}: Untap another target permanent.

cards.flavor: A gwyllion's favorite trap is the vanity mirror. A bewitched piece of glass traps the looker's soul and does away with the body.

cards.text: Exile target creature.

Flying

cards.flavor: Only in Ravnica do the wolves watch the flock.

cards.flavor:

cards.flavor: The maze-like design embodies the core of Azorius law—strict structure designed to test wills and stall change.

cards.flavor: An emblem of a secret guild, the Dimir insignia is seen only by its own members—and the doomed.

cards.text: {1}, {T}: Add {U}{B} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: Only the Eldrazi mind thinks in the warped paths required to open the hedrons and tap the power within.

cards.text:
{T}: Add {3} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Duplicant
cards.text:
Imprint — When Duplicant enters the battlefield, you may exile target nontoken creature.
As long as a card exiled with Duplicant is a creature card, Duplicant has the power, toughness, and creature types of the last creature card exiled with Duplicant. It's still a Shapeshifter.

Everflowing Chalice enters the battlefield with a charge counter on it for each time it was kicked.

cards.flavor: Gruul territorial markings need not be legible. The blood, snot, and muck used to smear them are unmistakably Gruul.
cards.name: Gruul Signet
cards.text: {1}, {T}: Add {R}{G} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: Built with neither a way to steer nor a way to stop, the juggernauts were simply aimed at an enemy's best defenses and told to charge.
cards.name: Juggernaut
cards.text:
Juggernaut attacks each turn if able.
Juggernaut can't be blocked by Walls.

cards.flavor: After lightning struck the cliffs, the ore became iron, the iron became steel, and the steel became greaves. The lightning never left.

cards.flavor:

—Noyan Dar, Tazeem lullmage

cards.flavor: Only a focused mind can survive it.

cards.flavor: Simun the Quiet filled the chest with his most precious thoughts. But in a fit of paranoia, he locked up the memory of where he hid the key.
